{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Specialist",
  "description": "Deslog Energy Services Limited is a wholly Nigerian owned Energy services company that offers efficient and customized solutions to solve the African regions challenges in Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Installation and Commissioning. We are dedicated to execute projects and services for the Government, Energy and Oil and Gas industry with the highest quality standards possible as we continue to evolve and make advances in line with international best practices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Business Development Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Role Description


	The Business Development Specialist will be responsible for generating leads, conducting market research, and providing excellent customer service.
	Daily tasks include analyzing market trends, developing business strategies, and communicating with potential clients to expand business opportunities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
	Excellent Analytical Skills for market and business analysis
	Strong Communication and Customer Service skills
	Experience in Lead Generation and Market Research
	Ability to develop and implement effective business strategies
	Proven track record in business development and client management
	Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-01",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Business Development Specialist Job at Deslog Energy Services Limited




        
    

        
        Deslog Energy Services Limited is a wholly Nigerian owned Energy services company that offers efficient and customized solutions to solve the African regions challenges in Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Installation and Commissioning. We are dedicated to execute projects and services for the Government, Energy and Oil and Gas industry with the highest quality standards possible as we continue to evolve and make advances in line with international best practices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Specialist

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Role Description
     

            
    




	The Business Development Specialist will be responsible for generating leads, conducting market research, and providing excellent customer service.
	Daily tasks include analyzing market trends, developing business strategies, and communicating with potential clients to expand business opportunities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
	Excellent Analytical Skills for market and business analysis
	Strong Communication and Customer Service skills
	Experience in Lead Generation and Market Research
	Ability to develop and implement effective business strategies
	Proven track record in business development and client management
	Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operation Manager",
  "description": "Cravecity Mega Limited is a Quick service restaurant. We offer excellent services with the best bites that satisfies every customers cravings. We encourage a favourable work environment by promoting a greatwork culture.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operation Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Operations Manager in a QSR will beresponsible for overseeing daily restaurant operations across multiple outlets to ensure efficiency, profitability, and consistent delivery of high-quality food and customer service.
	This role involves supervising outlet managers, ensuring compliance with operational standards, managing budgets, optimizing resources, and driving performance to achieve business goals.
	The Operations Manager serves as a bridge between senior management and outlet teams, ensuring smooth execution of company policies and strategies.


Key Responsibilities
Operations Management:


	Oversee daily operations of all QSR outlets, ensuring adherence to company standards in food quality, speed of service, cleanliness, and safety.
	Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to maintain consistency across all locations.
	Monitor and analyze operational performance (sales, customer feedback, wastage, labor costs) and take corrective actions where necessary.


People Management:


	Lead, coach, and mentor outlet managers and their teams to drive operational excellence.
	Ensure proper staffing levels, training, and shift scheduling across outlets.
	Promote a culture of accountability, teamwork, and customer-first service.
	Handle escalated employee or customer issues professionally.


Financial &amp; Business Performance:


	Monitor sales, cost of goods sold (COGS), labor costs, and overheads to maintain profitability.
	Assist in setting and achieving sales targets, budgets, and KPIs for each outlet.
	Control inventory levels and minimize waste through effective stock management and reconciliation.
	Provide weekly and monthly operational performance reports to senior management.


Compliance &amp; Quality Control:


	Ensure all outlets comply with food safety, hygiene, and health regulations.
	Conduct regular inspections and audits of outlets for quality assurance.
	Enforce brand consistency in service, menu presentation, and customer experience.


Strategic &amp; Process Improvement:


	Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
	Implement new technologies, systems, or processes to enhance productivity.
	Support new store openings, including recruitment, training, and setup.
	Collaborate with other departments (HR, Finance, Procurement, Marketing) to support business objectives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or related field.
	5&ndash;7 years of experience in restaurant or QSR operations, with at least 3 years in a managerial role.
	Proficiency in MS Office and familiarity with POS and inventory management systems.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies


	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Good financial acumen and ability to interpret P&amp;L reports.
	Knowledge of QSR industry trends, food safety, and hygiene regulations.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work under pressure.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrbp@cravecityng.com&nbsp;using &quot;Procurement QSR&quot; as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07017425977.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-01",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Operation Manager Job at Cravecity Mega Limited




        
    

        
        Cravecity Mega Limited is a Quick service restaurant. We offer excellent services with the best bites that satisfies every customers cravings. We encourage a favourable work environment by promoting a greatwork culture.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operation Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Operations Manager in a QSR will beresponsible for overseeing daily restaurant operations across multiple outlets to ensure efficiency, profitability, and consistent delivery of high-quality food and customer service.
	This role involves supervising outlet managers, ensuring compliance with operational standards, managing budgets, optimizing resources, and driving performance to achieve business goals.
	The Operations Manager serves as a bridge between senior management and outlet teams, ensuring smooth execution of company policies and strategies.


Key Responsibilities
Operations Management:


	Oversee daily operations of all QSR outlets, ensuring adherence to company standards in food quality, speed of service, cleanliness, and safety.
	Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to maintain consistency across all locations.
	Monitor and analyze operational performance (sales, customer feedback, wastage, labor costs) and take corrective actions where necessary.


People Management:


	Lead, coach, and mentor outlet managers and their teams to drive operational excellence.
	Ensure proper staffing levels, training, and shift scheduling across outlets.
	Promote a culture of accountability, teamwork, and customer-first service.
	Handle escalated employee or customer issues professionally.


Financial & Business Performance:


	Monitor sales, cost of goods sold (COGS), labor costs, and overheads to maintain profitability.
	Assist in setting and achieving sales targets, budgets, and KPIs for each outlet.
	Control inventory levels and minimize waste through effective stock management and reconciliation.
	Provide weekly and monthly operational performance reports to senior management.


Compliance & Quality Control:


	Ensure all outlets comply with food safety, hygiene, and health regulations.
	Conduct regular inspections and audits of outlets for quality assurance.
	Enforce brand consistency in service, menu presentation, and customer experience.


Strategic & Process Improvement:


	Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
	Implement new technologies, systems, or processes to enhance productivity.
	Support new store openings, including recruitment, training, and setup.
	Collaborate with other departments (HR, Finance, Procurement, Marketing) to support business objectives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or related field.
	5–7 years of experience in restaurant or QSR operations, with at least 3 years in a managerial role.
	Proficiency in MS Office and familiarity with POS and inventory management systems.


Key Skills & Competencies


	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Good financial acumen and ability to interpret P&L reports.
	Knowledge of QSR industry trends, food safety, and hygiene regulations.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work under pressure.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@cravecityng.com using "Procurement QSR" as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07017425977.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head of Marketing",
  "description": "Fidelam homes Limited is a real estate development company incorporated in Nigeria and located in the federal capital territory.&nbsp;At Fidelam homes we believe in integrity, commitment to excellence, a professional attitude and personalized care.&nbsp;We take pride in our exception architectural and modern home designs while keeping in mind affordability.&nbsp;Customer care is one of our strongest priority as we value our clients and provide bespoke service you deserve.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Marketing

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Roles and Duties


	The Head of Marketing is a company&#39;s top marketing executive.
	They are responsible for everything related to promoting the business, its products, and its brand.


Primary Goals


	Grow the business.
	Increase sales.
	Build a strong brand reputation.


Responsibilites
Strategic Leader:


	Create the marketing plan: They decide what marketing campaigns to run,&nbsp;who&nbsp;to target, and&nbsp;how&nbsp;to measure success.
	Set the budget: They manage and allocate the money for all marketing activities.


Team Manager:


	Lead the team: They hire, train, and guide the marketing team (e.g., social media managers, content creators, designers).
	Oversee projects: They ensure all marketing projects are on track and meet their goals.


Brand Guardian:


	Protect the brand: They make sure the company&#39;s message is consistent and positive across all platforms.
	Approve campaigns: They have the final say on all ads, press releases, and marketing materials.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor`s Degree with 3 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to:&nbsp;ElizabethKolawole@fidelamhomes.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Head of Marketing Job at Fidelam Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Fidelam homes Limited is a real estate development company incorporated in Nigeria and located in the federal capital territory. At Fidelam homes we believe in integrity, commitment to excellence, a professional attitude and personalized care. We take pride in our exception architectural and modern home designs while keeping in mind affordability. Customer care is one of our strongest priority as we value our clients and provide bespoke service you deserve.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Marketing

Job Location:  Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Roles and Duties
     

            
    




	The Head of Marketing is a company's top marketing executive.
	They are responsible for everything related to promoting the business, its products, and its brand.


Primary Goals


	Grow the business.
	Increase sales.
	Build a strong brand reputation.


Responsibilites
Strategic Leader:


	Create the marketing plan: They decide what marketing campaigns to run, who to target, and how to measure success.
	Set the budget: They manage and allocate the money for all marketing activities.


Team Manager:


	Lead the team: They hire, train, and guide the marketing team (e.g., social media managers, content creators, designers).
	Oversee projects: They ensure all marketing projects are on track and meet their goals.


Brand Guardian:


	Protect the brand: They make sure the company's message is consistent and positive across all platforms.
	Approve campaigns: They have the final say on all ads, press releases, and marketing materials.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor`s Degree with 3 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: ElizabethKolawole@fidelamhomes.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Supervisor",
  "description": "Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.&nbsp; Greenlight&rsquo;s Sun King&trade; products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location: Bauchi
Department: Operations
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Workplace type: Onsite
Reporting To: Country Warehouse Manager

About The Role


	We are looking for experienced Warehouse Supervisor who would leverage on their expertise to grow our business, strategizing warehouse process in other to satisfy our business.


Responsibilities
What you would be expected to do:


	Overseeing receiving, warehousing, and distribution operations.
	Ensure operational policies and procedures is well adhered to.
	Ensuring effective and safety of warehouse equipment.
	Ensuring the safety of warehouse employees.
	Maintaining documentation and keeping accurate records of warehouse activities.
	Safeguards warehouse operations and contents by establishing and monitoring security procedures, protocols and by managing people, processes and systems.
	Coordinates the investigation of unsafe conditions through the application of the company&rsquo;s safety standards.
	Complies with the federal, state and local warehousing processes, material handling requirements, etc.
	Ensure the daily reports of the warehouse are completed in stipulated time.
	Work closely with the logistic coordinator to resolve issues between warehousing and distribution processes.
	Ensure that all the supplies are received, documented, processed and proper acknowledgment given as at when due.
	Plan, assign and address complaints and resolve problems within the shortest time frame possible.
	Comply effectively with company work and safety rules.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	HND / B.Sc in Supply Chain Management or related background.
	3+ years of warehouse management experience in the Solar space, FMCG or related industry.
	Excellent knowledge of warehouse management procedures. Proficient knowledge of and inventory controls, staffs and products.
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suites. Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal. Good Managerial, organizational, multitasking, and problem-solving skills.
	Experience in the use of ERP systems is an added advantage.
",

Warehouse Supervisor Job at Greenlight Planet




        
    

        
        Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Greenlight’s Sun King™ products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor
     

            
    



Job Location: Bauchi
Department: Operations
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Workplace type: Onsite
Reporting To: Country Warehouse Manager

About The Role


	We are looking for experienced Warehouse Supervisor who would leverage on their expertise to grow our business, strategizing warehouse process in other to satisfy our business.


Responsibilities
What you would be expected to do:


	Overseeing receiving, warehousing, and distribution operations.
	Ensure operational policies and procedures is well adhered to.
	Ensuring effective and safety of warehouse equipment.
	Ensuring the safety of warehouse employees.
	Maintaining documentation and keeping accurate records of warehouse activities.
	Safeguards warehouse operations and contents by establishing and monitoring security procedures, protocols and by managing people, processes and systems.
	Coordinates the investigation of unsafe conditions through the application of the company’s safety standards.
	Complies with the federal, state and local warehousing processes, material handling requirements, etc.
	Ensure the daily reports of the warehouse are completed in stipulated time.
	Work closely with the logistic coordinator to resolve issues between warehousing and distribution processes.
	Ensure that all the supplies are received, documented, processed and proper acknowledgment given as at when due.
	Plan, assign and address complaints and resolve problems within the shortest time frame possible.
	Comply effectively with company work and safety rules.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	HND / B.Sc in Supply Chain Management or related background.
	3+ years of warehouse management experience in the Solar space, FMCG or related industry.
	Excellent knowledge of warehouse management procedures. Proficient knowledge of and inventory controls, staffs and products.
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suites. Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal. Good Managerial, organizational, multitasking, and problem-solving skills.
	Experience in the use of ERP systems is an added advantage.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Business Development Manager",
  "description": "FoodOnline&nbsp;Limited is a dynamic food delivery and logistics tech company revolutionizing how Nigerians access meals. It connects users to their favorite restaurants and food vendors through a fast, user-friendly mobile app.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for an experienced and ambitious Senior Business Development Executive to drive growth for our online food delivery platform in Abuja.
	This role requires a proactive leader with 5+ years of proven experience in business development, sales, or partnerships &mdash; preferably within e-commerce, food delivery, logistics, or related industries.
	The Senior Business Development Executive will be responsible for securing high-value partnerships with restaurants, vendors, and corporate clients while shaping strategies that expand our market reach and strengthen customer loyalty.


Job Responsibilities


	Drive onboarding of restaurants, food vendors, and key partners onto the platform.
	Negotiate and close strategic partnerships that increase platform adoption and revenue.
	Identify, pursue, and secure opportunities with corporate clients for bulk/recurring orders.
	Conduct market research to understand customer needs, industry trends, and competition.
	Develop tailored pitches, presentations, and proposals to attract and retain partners.
	Build and maintain long-term relationships with vendors, restaurants, and stakeholders.
	Collaborate with marketing, operations, and product teams to execute growth strategies.
	Mentor and support junior business development staff in meeting departmental goals.
	Provide reports, forecasts, and insights on performance metrics to senior management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (MBA is a plus).
	5+ years of experience in business development, sales, or partnerships (experience in food-tech, e-commerce, or logistics is highly desirable).
	Demonstrated success in securing high-value deals and consistently achieving growth targets.
	Strong understanding of the Abuja food, hospitality, or e-commerce market is an added advantage.


Skills &amp; Experience:


	Excellent negotiation and deal-closing skills.
	Strong leadership and mentorship abilities.
	Effective communication and presentation skills.
	Strategic thinker with a problem-solving mindset.
	Ability to build and sustain long-term business relationships.
	Proficiency in CRM tools, sales reporting, and business analytics.
	Resilient and adaptable in a fast-paced, competitive environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;foodonlinehr@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Senior Business Development Manager Job at FoodOnline Limited




        
    

        
        FoodOnline Limited is a dynamic food delivery and logistics tech company revolutionizing how Nigerians access meals. It connects users to their favorite restaurants and food vendors through a fast, user-friendly mobile app.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Business Development Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for an experienced and ambitious Senior Business Development Executive to drive growth for our online food delivery platform in Abuja.
	This role requires a proactive leader with 5+ years of proven experience in business development, sales, or partnerships — preferably within e-commerce, food delivery, logistics, or related industries.
	The Senior Business Development Executive will be responsible for securing high-value partnerships with restaurants, vendors, and corporate clients while shaping strategies that expand our market reach and strengthen customer loyalty.


Job Responsibilities


	Drive onboarding of restaurants, food vendors, and key partners onto the platform.
	Negotiate and close strategic partnerships that increase platform adoption and revenue.
	Identify, pursue, and secure opportunities with corporate clients for bulk/recurring orders.
	Conduct market research to understand customer needs, industry trends, and competition.
	Develop tailored pitches, presentations, and proposals to attract and retain partners.
	Build and maintain long-term relationships with vendors, restaurants, and stakeholders.
	Collaborate with marketing, operations, and product teams to execute growth strategies.
	Mentor and support junior business development staff in meeting departmental goals.
	Provide reports, forecasts, and insights on performance metrics to senior management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (MBA is a plus).
	5+ years of experience in business development, sales, or partnerships (experience in food-tech, e-commerce, or logistics is highly desirable).
	Demonstrated success in securing high-value deals and consistently achieving growth targets.
	Strong understanding of the Abuja food, hospitality, or e-commerce market is an added advantage.


Skills & Experience:


	Excellent negotiation and deal-closing skills.
	Strong leadership and mentorship abilities.
	Effective communication and presentation skills.
	Strategic thinker with a problem-solving mindset.
	Ability to build and sustain long-term business relationships.
	Proficiency in CRM tools, sales reporting, and business analytics.
	Resilient and adaptable in a fast-paced, competitive environment.


Method of Application
